title: Western Ghats Districts on Alert as IMD Predicts Light to Moderate Rain - LiveChennai
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a weather alert for districts along the Western Ghats, following the formation of a lower-level atmospheric circulation over the Lakshadweep region and the adjoining southeast Arabian Sea.

Weather Forecast Today

- Light to moderate rainfall is likely at isolated places in Western Ghats districts

- Dry weather is expected across the rest of Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal

- Light fog may occur at a few places during early morning hours

Northeast Monsoon Update

The IMD stated that the Northeast Monsoon is likely to withdraw within the next two days from Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, and adjoining south Indian regions.

Chennai Weather Today

- Sky condition: Partly cloudy

- Maximum temperature: 31–32°C

- Minimum temperature: Around 21°C

- Early morning hours may witness light fog at isolated locations

Fishermen Advisory

No warning has been issued for fishermen, indicating normal sea conditions along the coast.
